availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James C. Barnes (Princeton, Kentucky, deputy clerk)

body.p: Princeton, Kentucky, deputy clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Richard Barnes and Mary J. Barnes. Married to M. E. Barnes. Father of Arthur Barnes. Resident of Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Deputy clerk in Princeton in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 346; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 105; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 508.
